TITLE: European Central Bank hikes rates despite market mayhem, pledges support if needed
SUMMARY: Some market players questioned whether President Christine Lagarde would proceed with a hike, given recent shocks in the banking sector.

TITLE: Long-awaited Fed digital payment system to launch in July
SUMMARY: FedNow creates "a leading-edge payments system that is resilient, adaptive, and accessible," said Richmond Fed President Tom Barkin.

TITLE: Goldman Sachs cuts GDP forecast because of stress on small banks, which are key to U.S. economy
SUMMARY: Goldman on Wednesday lowered its 2023 economic growth forecast, citing a pullback in lending from small- and medium-sized banks.

TITLE: One of the best ways to figure out what the Fed will do next is to look at regional bank stocks
SUMMARY: Markets have changed their mind — again — about what they think the Federal Reserve will do next week regarding interest rates.

TITLE: Wholesale prices post unexpected decline of 0.1% in February; retail sales fall
SUMMARY: The producer price index was expected to increase 0.3% in February, according to Dow Jones estimates.

TITLE: Moody's Analytics' Mark Zandi says Fed unlikely to hike rates in March given banking turmoil
SUMMARY: The Federal Reserve will likely not raise interest rates at its March meeting as there is still a "boatload of uncertainty" said Mark Zandi of Moody's Analytics.

TITLE: Inflation gauge increased 0.4% in February, as expected and up 6% from a year ago
SUMMARY: Excluding volatile food and energy prices, core CPI increased 0.5% in February and 5.5% on a 12-month basis.

TITLE: Something broke, but the Fed is still expected to go through with rate hikes
SUMMARY: Markets still expect the Fed to keep up its inflation-fighting efforts, despite high-profile bank failures that have rattled the financial system.

TITLE: Just like that: Market pricing swings back to quarter-point Fed rate hike
SUMMARY: One bank implosion and a cooperative jobs report later, and the market has changed its mind.

TITLE: Unemployment for Black and Hispanic women rose in February, but more workers join the labor force
SUMMARY: Black women saw their unemployment rate jump to 5.1% from 4.7%. Among Hispanic women, it jumped to 4.8% from 4.4%.

TITLE: Here's where the jobs are for February 2023 — in one chart
SUMMARY: The leisure and hospitality sector added 105,000 jobs last month, according to the Labor Department, accounting for roughly a third of the total jobs gain.

TITLE: Payrolls rose 311,000 in February, more than expected, showing solid growth
SUMMARY: Nonfarm payrolls were expected to increase by 225,000 in February, while the unemployment rate was projected to hold at 3.4%, according to Dow Jones.

TITLE: UK economy rebounds with stronger-than-expected January GDP print
SUMMARY: The U.K. economy grew by 0.3% in January, official figures showed on Friday, exceeding expectations as it continues to fend off what economists see as an inevitable recession.

TITLE: Job openings declined in January but still far outnumber available workers
SUMMARY: The Labor Department's Job Openings and Labor Turnover Survey showed there are 10.824 million openings, down some 410,000 from December.

TITLE: Private payrolls rose by 242,000 in February, better than expected, ADP says
SUMMARY: Companies added jobs at a brisk pace in February as the labor market kept humming, payroll services firm ADP reported Wednesday.

TITLE: How China's shifting growth picture could hit global markets
SUMMARY: China's economy will be forced to recalibrate because of a "fractured" global order, and the new drivers of growth will "disappoint" global markets, according to David Roche.

TITLE: Fed's Powell heads to Capitol Hill this week, and he's going to have his hands full
SUMMARY: Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell to appear before Congress with a tall task.

TITLE: Tesla is not the only company reviewing its Europe investment after Biden's Inflation Reduction Act
SUMMARY: Many multinationals are reconsidering or changing previous plans to deploy new money into Europe.

TITLE: Euro zone inflation softens to 8.5% in February as ECB signals interest rate hiking is not over
SUMMARY: Inflation in the euro zone came in at 8.5% in February, while the ECB signalled interest rate hikes could still continue.

TITLE: The racial retirement savings gap remains wide – How these state IRA programs are working toward equity
SUMMARY: Workers have put away $735 million in state retirement savings programs that are intended to help employees at small businesses.

TITLE: Fed can't tame inflation without 'significantly' more hikes that will cause a recession, paper says
SUMMARY: The Federal Reserve is unlikely to be able to bring down inflation without having to push rates considerably higher, according to a research paper.

TITLE: Key Fed inflation measure rose 0.6% in January, more than expected
SUMMARY: The core PCE price index was expected to increase 0.5% from a month ago and 4.4% on an annual basis, according to Dow Jones.

TITLE: OECD says global economic outlook 'slightly better' for 2023 but inflation risks linger
SUMMARY: OECD Secretary-General Mathias Cormann said the global economic outlook is looking slightly "brighter" for this year but inflation challenges remain.

TITLE: UK economy in 'a lot better shape' than bleak figures suggest, fund manager says
SUMMARY: The U.K. has thus far avoided a widely anticipated recession, and the economy may be holding up better than feared, according to veteran fund manager Andy Brough.

TITLE: Consumer debt hits record $16.9 trillion as delinquencies also rise
SUMMARY: Debt across all categories totaled $16.9 trillion as balances rose across all major categories.

TITLE: Wholesale prices rose 0.7% in January, more than expected, fueling inflation increase
SUMMARY: The producer price index, a measure of what raw goods fetch on the open market, rose 0.7% in January.

TITLE: Sanctions on Russian oil are having the 'intended effect,' IEA says
SUMMARY: Bans and price caps targeting Russian oil are having the "intended effect" despite surprisingly resilient exports in recent months, according to the International Energy Agency.

TITLE: Retail sales jump 3% in January, smashing expectations despite inflation increase
SUMMARY: Retail sales were expected to increase 1.9% in January, according to Dow Jones.

TITLE: Russia's budget deficit has surged. But economists say Moscow won't drain its war chest any time soon
SUMMARY: Russia's budget deficit hit a record 1.8 trillion rubles ($24.4 billion) in January, with spending growing by 58% from the previous year while revenues fell by more than a third.

TITLE: Inflation rose 0.5% in January, more than expected and up 6.4% from a year ago
SUMMARY: The consumer price index was expected to increase 0.4% in January from a month ago and 6.2% on an annual basis, according to Dow Jones.
